newsitem.title: MALAYSIA: Malaysia rubber stronger at close on Tokyo.
newsitem.headline: Malaysia rubber stronger at close on Tokyo.

text.p: The Malaysian rubber market was stronger at the close after a higher Tokyo market led to some local covering, dealers said.
But trading was slow with most players awaiting further developments locally and in Thailand before commiting themselves.
"It's the start of the week and we did not see much inquiries from abroad," a dealer said. "But some covering is expected from the Europeans ahead of the summer holidays."
Asian countries may continue to adopt a wait-and-see attitude while waiting for cheaper prices.
Trading houses offered SMR CV at 332 cents a kg, SMR L at 308, SMR 10 at 263 and drum latex at 227.

Trading was cautious at the start of the month due to switch-over to new spot month. July RSS Ones buyer finished 1.50 cents to 286.50 cents ($1.13) a kg from Friday, and July SMR 20 buyer rose two to 268 cents.
The INRO five-day moving average for May 30 was 214.75 Malaysian/Singapore cents per kg against 214.09 for May 29. The daily indicator price was 215.81 against 215.15.
